article.headline: Eastern Michigan 77, Buffalo 66
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- Markus Austin scored 19 points to lead Eastern Michigan to a 77-66 win over Buffalo Wednesday night. John Bowler had 15 points and 12 rebounds for Eastern Michigan (8-10, 3-7 Mid-American Conference). JaQuan Hart had 12 points and James Douglas 11. Eastern Michigan erased a seven-point second half deficit with an 18-3 run midway through the period. Austin highlighted the run with a three-point play at 10:03 that put the Eagles ahead for good. Dan Redder closed the run with a lay up that made the score 56-48 with 7:24 left. Turner Battle led Buffalo (8-10, 4-6) with 20 points. Daniel Gilbert scored 11 points and Mario Jordan 10. Buffalo's Mark Bortz, a 78-percent free throw shooter in conference play entering the game, went 3-12 from the free throw line and was a big part of the Bulls' 10-24 performance in foul shots.
